abstract: Many graph concepts such as cliques, k -clubs, and k -plexes are used to define cohesive subgroups in a social network. The concept of densest k-set is one of them. A densest k-set in an undirected graph G=(V,E)G=(V,E) is a vertex set S⊆VS⊆V of size k such that the number of edges in the subgraph of G induced by S is maximum among all subgraphs of G induced by vertex sets of size k . One can obtain a densest k -set of G in O(k2nk)O(k2nk) time by exhaustive-search technique for an undirected graph of n vertices and a number k<nk<n. However, if the value of k approaches n/2n/2, the running time of the exhaustive-search algorithm is O⁎(2n)O⁎(2n). Whether there exists an O⁎(cn)O⁎(cn)-time algorithm with the fixed constant c<2c<2 to find a densest k -set in an undirected graph of n vertices remains open in the literature. In this paper, we point out that the densest k -set problem and and a class of problems related to the concept of densest k -sets can be solved in time O⁎(1.7315n)O⁎(1.7315n).
